== 2009 ==
=== April 2009 ===
*'''29''' – ''[[Infiniminer]]'' is released, a game by [http://www.zachtronicsindustries.com/ Zachtronics Industries] (creators of the critically acclaimed 2011 puzzle game ''{{wikipedia|SpaceChem}}''), whose concept mainly inspired Notch for ''Minecraft''.<ref>{{Citation|url=http://thesiteformerlyknownas.zachtronicsindustries.com/infiniminer/|title=Infiniminer|author=[http://thesiteformerlyknownas.zachtronicsindustries.com/author/admin/ Zach]|website=Zachtronics Industries|date=April 29, 2009}}</ref> It was regularly updated and became open-source less than a month later.<ref>{{Citation|url=http://thesiteformerlyknownas.zachtronicsindustries.com/apparently-im-now-in-charge-of-an-open-source-project/|title=Apparently I’m now in charge of an open source project.|author=[http://thesiteformerlyknownas.zachtronicsindustries.com/author/admin/ Zach]|website=Zachtronics Industries|date=May 16, 2009}}</ref>

=== May 2009 – Birth of ''Minecraft''===
*'''10''' – Development on "Cave Game" started using ''[[RubyDung]]'', an abandoned game project of Notch, and ''Infiniminer'' as bases for the code.
*'''13''' – ''Java'': [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F9t3FREAZ-k First video of "Cave Game"], [[Block]] placement, first [[Mobs]] (simply named [[Mob (entity)|Mob]]), physics created ([[Cave game tech test]]).
*'''14''' – ''Java'': "Cave Game" renamed to "Minecraft: Order of the Stone" after a suggestion by [https://tig.fandom.com/wiki/RinkuHero RinkuHero] from [https://tig.fandom.com/wiki/The_Independent_Games_Wiki The Independent Games Wiki] on an IRC with Notch, ''"Minecraft"'' being an analogy to the famous real-time strategy game ''{{wikipedia|StarCraft_(series)|StarCraft}}'' ([[Pre-classic]]).<ref>{{Tumblr|notch|107676487|Minecraft: Order of the Stone|May 14, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101101033615/http://notch.tumblr.com/post/107676487/minecraft-order-of-the-stone}}</ref>
*'''16''' – ''Java'':  Early private testing, among TIGSource members ([[Classic 0.0.2a]]-[[0.0.9a]]).<ref>{{Tumblr|notch|108652448|Early private singleplayer alpha coming very soon|May 16, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110301235605/http://notch.tumblr.com/post/108652448/early-private-singleplayer-alpha-coming-very-soon}}</ref>
*'''17''' – '''''First release of the game ([[Classic 0.0.11a]]).''''' Game name shortened to simply "Minecraft".<ref>{{Tumblr|notch|20101212003216|Yeah, that’s the logo. *'''21''' – Accounts can now be registered.<ref>{{Tumblr|notch|110745397|You can register your accounts now|May 21, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090602212128/http://notch.tumblr.com/post/110745397/you-can-register-your-accounts-now}}</ref>
*'''24''' – An official ''Minecraft'' Forum is opened.<ref>{{Tumblr|notch|112349891|There's an official forum now|May 24, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090603004530/http://notch.tumblr.com/post/112349891/theres-an-official-forum-now}}</ref>
